attributes.action: Exempt archery ranges from the list of venues required to close due to Covid-19
attributes.additional_details: The Parliament should allow archery and shooting ranges and clubs to open so families or individuals can practise in order to exercise safely, as this type of sport is well suited for distancing guidelines and safe.
attributes.background: The Government should allow archery and shooting ranges and clubs to open so families or individuals can practise in order to exercise safely, as this type of sport is well suited for distancing guidelines and safe.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition, the national lockdown in England has ended. Under the local tier restrictions introduced from 2 December, sporting facilities can reopen and indoor and outdoor sport can restart, though there are restrictions on indoor activities in the highest risk areas (tier 3). See
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/local-restriction-tiers-what-you-need-to-know

You could start a new petition calling for changes to the local tier approach, if there are changes you wish to see happen.
